page.title: 19Pendomer & Halstock-Skittles
page.content: Almost every village pub in Somerset and Dorset has its skittle alley. There are pub teams, works teams, WI teams, farmers' club teams - enough to provide fixtures most evenings through from autumn to spring. The game is enjoyed by both men and women of all ages. Halstock's pub is no exception. For the benefit of strangers to the West Country, it should perhaps be explained that skittles is played on a wooden floor about thirty feet long and six feet wide - butthe measurements vary. Nine wooden skittles about a foot high are set up in a recognised pattern at one end, and each member of the team in turn rolls three balls, one at a time, from the other. The aim is to knock down as many skittles as possible. Knocking down all nine in one go gains an extra point.
